clinical_study.brief_title: Allogeneic Hematopoietic Cell Transplantation HLA-matched Donor After Flu-Mel vs Flu-Mel-ATG Conditioning
clinical_study.official_title: Allogeneic Hematopoietic Cell Transplantation From HLA-matched Donor After Fludarabine-Melphalan Versus Fludarabine-Melphalan-ATG Reduced-intensity Conditioning: a Phase III Randomized Study From the Belgian Hematology Society (BHS)

brief_summary.textblock: The present project aims at comparing two conditioning regimens (Fludarabine-Melphalan (FM) vs Fludarabine-Melphalan-ATG (FM-ATG)). The hypothesis is that the FM-ATG regimen will be associated to better cGRFS.

detailed_description.textblock: This study is a multicenter, randomized, open-label, phase III study, comparing 2 conditioning regimens. A total of 284 eligible patients with HLA (Human Leukocyte Antigen)-matched donors will be randomized 1/1 between the FM arm and the FM-ATG arm, with stratification for donor type (related or unrelated). The recruitment period is 5 years with a 5-year follow-up plus a 10-year additional long-term follow-up (for Graft-versus-host disease (GVHD) status, disease status, second malignancy and QOL). The whole study will be completed within 20 years. The hypothesis is that the FM-ATG regimen will be associated to better cGRFS (current GVHD-free, relapse-free survival).

primary_outcome.time_frame: 15 years (the primary endpoint will be first assessed after 191 events have been reached)
primary_outcome.description: To compare the current GVHD-free, relapse-free survival (cGRFS) for patients in the 2 arms

secondary_outcome.description: To compare cGRFS for patients conditioned with FM or FM-ATG separately in those transplanted with a related or an unrelated donor
To compare the relapse/progression rate for patients conditioned with FM or FM-ATG
To compare rate of grade II-IV and III-IV acute GVHD (Graft-versus-host disease) in patients conditioned with FM or FM-ATG.
To compare rate of grade of moderate-severe chronic GVHD in patients conditioned with FM or FM-ATG.
To compare rate of Nonrelapse Mortality in patients conditioned with FM or FM-ATG.
To compare rate of Leukemia Free Survival in patients conditioned with FM or FM-ATG.
To compare rate of Overall Survival in patients conditioned with FM or FM-ATG.
To compare the proportion of patients alive without active disease and without systemic immunosuppression

other_outcome.description: To compare hematopoietic (whole blood and T cell chimerism) engraftment in the 2 arms.
To compare the quality of immunologic reconstitution in the 2 arms
To compare the timing (days) of immunologic reconstitution in the 2 arms
To compare the incidences of bacterial infections (number of episode, site, grade) in the 2 arms, in the whole group of patients
To compare the incidences of fungal infections (number of episode, site, grade) in the 2 arms, in the whole group of patients
To compare the incidences of viral infections (number of episode, site, grade) in the 2 arms, in the whole group of patients
To assess kinetics of functional ATG serum levels (mg/L) in the FM-ATG arm

other_outcome.measure: Assess ATG Pharmacokinetic in association with cGRFS
other_outcome.description: To assess kinetics of functional ATG serum levels (mg/L) in the FM-ATG arm in association with cGRFS

other_outcome.measure: Assess ATG Pharmacokinetic in association with NRM
other_outcome.description: To assess kinetics of functional ATG serum levels (mg/L) in the FM-ATG arm in association with NRM

other_outcome.measure: Assess ATG Pharmacokinetic in association with OS
other_outcome.description: To assess kinetics of functional ATG serum levels (mg/L) in the FM-ATG arm in association with OS

other_outcome.measure: Assess ATG Pharmacokinetic in association with Relapse/progression
other_outcome.description: To assess kinetics of functional ATG serum levels (mg/L) in the FM-ATG arm in association with Relapse/progression

other_outcome.measure: Assess ATG Pharmacokinetic in association with Infections
other_outcome.description: To assess kinetics of functional ATG serum levels (mg/L) in the FM-ATG arm in association with Infections

other_outcome.description: To assess kinetics of functional ATG serum levels (mg/L) in the FM-ATG arm in association with immunologic reconstitution (CD4 and NAIVE T cells counts)

arm_group.description: It consists in IV fludarabine 30 mg/m2 on days -5, -4, -3, -2 and -1 (total dose 150 mg/m2; 80% of the dose if creatinine clearance between 30% and 70% and 60% of the dose if clearance < 30%.) and melphalan given at the dose of 140 mg/m2 on day -2 (Adjusted body weight should be use in case of patient body weight > 120% ideal body weight).

It consists in IV fludarabine 30 mg/m2 on days -5, -4, -3, -2 and -1 (total dose 150 mg/m2; 80% of the dose if creatinine clearance between 30% and 70% and 60% of the dose if clearance < 30%.) and melphalan given at the dose of 140 mg/m2 on day -2 (Adjusted body weight should be use in case of patient body weight > 120% ideal body weight) and ATG (Thymoglobulin®, Genzyme), at a dose of 2.5 mg/kg/d on days -2 and -1.

intervention.description: ATG: 2.5 mg /kg/day on day -2 and -1 (day 0 is allogenic transplantation)
